page.title: 01LAW AND ORDER 1
page.content: Although{Towcester}is not very large, it has it's own{Magistrates' {Court.}In the Towcester Magistrates' Court there is a bench where a group of Magistrates sit - they are called {the bench.}In front of that there is the{clerk's desk.}He asks the Magistrates for their opinion on the case. The Magistrates have no real knowledge of the law, they just decide whether a person is{'guilty' or 'not {guilty'}- which is why the clerk is there. The clerk knows a lot about the law, so he{gathers information}from the witness and the accused. Then he asks the Magistrates' whether the accused is guilty or not. To the right of the clerk are the {press.}In front of the clerk are two people, who both help. One person will speak against the accused and the other will say things for the accused.
